java.io.IOException: cleartool process exited with exit status [0]
        at com.atlassian.fisheye.clearcase.CleartoolInteractiveProcess.exec(CleartoolInteractiveProcess.java:287)

|[!http://img.skitch.com/20100315-tygebf9sg7qc2s81d6mp1nxe31.png|width=400!|http://img.skitch.com/20100315-tygebf9sg7qc2s81d6mp1nxe31.png]|

fields.description:
There are notable inconsistencies and usability differences between the diff views for the {{ChangeSet}} and the {{diff}} views. This makes it less obvious on how to perform the same actions within each view.

Notable differences are
- Most notable is the font differences, please see FE-2513
- {{View}} menu is missing from the {{ChangeSet}} view making it harder to alter these settings quickly.
- {{View in Activity Stream}} is missing from the {{diff}} view.
- {{Keyword Expansion}} action is missing from the {{ChangeSet}} view.
- {{Reviews}} is a single action menu containing {{Create Review}} within the {{diff}} view but is a single action {{Create review}} on the {{ChangeSet}} view.

Some of these differences can be achieved by going to the user settings from within each view affected for missing settings options, and other actions are just different places, it would be best to keep things consistent especially for trying to show people how to use the system.
fields.summary: ChangeSet diff and file diff views are not consistent

fields.description:
Please add the ability to change the font properties for the diff views for both the {{ChangeSet}} and the {{diff}} view. Currently these are not consistent with a difference in colour and line-height.

Add properties for:
- Font Family: Suggest providing [monospace, courier, courier-new], of course this is subject to user font availability.
- Font Size
- Line Height
- Font weight
- Show Whitespace Differences: checkbox defaulting to true.
fields.summary: Add ability to change the font properties for diff/changeset views.

fields.description:
I started a Thread in the forums:

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=41935&tstart=0

But it's been ignored so far, so I'm asking here again for support.

I'd like to be able to get some health performance and throughput information out of the system.

i.e.: I'd like to see the Memory generations, the thread numbers and the number of requests handled, maybe see what the scanner threads do, etc...


Thank you for your feedback!
so long,
Igor
fields.summary: Monitoring Fisheye Performance and Througput values

fields.description:

3. Back to JIRA, the review title is displayed differently. Please see the screenshot here
* http://www.screencast.com/users/chaiying84/folders/Jing/media/e66f522a-aa5d-4be7-a2f6-d93923c9cd6a

Tested in 3.13.4 - 4.0, the problem is replicable but not in 3.12.3

fields.description:
Cloned from: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-321

We have our SVN mirrored onto our FishEye machine and FishEye setup to scan using a file:/// protocol.

Every once and a while it seems it is unable to get/parse the author and/or the comment (usually it fails to get both) and instead shows the change list in FishEye as having the author of the daemon account that is syncing Subversion (we have a pre-commit hook that accepts the JIRA key at the least in the comments).

If I go onto the box and query the subversion mirror using "svn log" and the same file:/// path, it is able to get the author and comment fine, so it is not a problem with our SVN mirror.

This has occurred about 3 times in the last ~100 revisions, so it has become a matter of concern for us.

As far as I can tell there is no similarity between the change sets that it misses. They all have different authors, going to different paths and have different comments / comment style.
fields.summary: CLONE -FishEye occasionally does not get the author and/or comment for change sets

fields.description:
You don't need to provide an email when you create a user, but if you try to edit a user without an email address, and there are other users without email addresses you get the following error: 

!http://img.skitch.com/20100310-kn65hjb28j17kdcr4fxr1771r2.jpg!
fields.summary: Cannot edit users with blank email addresses

fields.description:
I am using a starter license, and while trying to get the total committers down to 10, I used the suggested approach of starting from a later revision:
{quote}
*Set a starting point*
Some of the FishEye SCM integrations allow you to configure a starting revision from which to start indexing. All commits prior to this starting point are not included in FishEye and do not contribute to the committer count. [Read more|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Configuring+Repository+Details].
{quote}
 However, if you do this and choose to initially import the state of the repository prior to that revision, FishEye will create an anonymous user that ends up counting against the 10 committer limit, so actually you only get to have 9 committers. I think this is a bit unfair, as the whole idea was to skip over commits made by other users, yet we get penalized by then only getting 9 committer slots instead of 10. And if you don't choose to do an initial import, you lose access to any files within the repository that were never touched by anyone after that revision, which should not be part of the restriction as the license currently reads.

FYI, this is using a subversion repository.
fields.summary: When using the "initial import" feature, an anonymous committer is automatically created which counts against your license

fields.description: Getting popup: (Message from Webpage) 'Warning: Internet Explorer 6.0 is not a supported browser and your experience will be severely degraded. Please consider upgrading to a new browser.' in IE8.0

Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Setup a fisheye application in crowd
# Create a group for Fisheye application e.g crowd-administrators
# Setup crowd authentication in fisheye
# Once it has synchronized, the groups are imported and there is no "Delete" link to delete the groups (expected behavior)
# Remove the crowd authentication and the 'Delete' link is still not shown

Here is the screenshot:
* http://www.screencast.com/users/mgchong/folders/Jing/media/d082355a-42d9-4757-a485-1fcd4606e149
fields.summary: Not able to delete groups when Crowd authentication is removed

fields.description:
From Customer:

{quote}
Problem Description:
Hi,

Apologies if this is not the way to log a feature request but I couldn't see how you do it through your website.

We have 'linkers' configured so when someone mentions 'Task 10254' in a checkin comment it becomes a link to the task in our internal bug tracking software.

When we check-in code we don't always mention the task number in the comment, but we do always populate a subversion property named 'TASK' with the number of the bug.

e.g. underneath a commit in Fisheye you see something like:

Properties
BRANCH = Dev
TASK = 22731

We would like to make the 22731 a link. Can you please tell me if this already possible (I don't think it is) and if not could you please log as a feature request and let me know if I need to do anything (e.g. vote for it somehow).

Thanks,

Brad.
{quote}
fields.summary: Enable linkers to work against subversion properties

Crowd has already support for nested groups, we are able to login fo Fisheye, but is impossible to set security settings per-repository with nested groups support.
fields.summary: nested groups support in security settings

fields.description:
If you have a number of different repositories (which is very common if you're using Git or another DVCS where often you'll have one repository per project), and a lot of users, you have to do a LOT of User Mapping entries to support that type of use case.

So if I have N users, and M repositories, I need to have N*M manually added entries in the User Mapping table in order to support all my different mapping points.

It would be much easier if I could just have N entries (with "all repositories" set), and maybe a few overrides or extra ones for repositories where that doesn't match properly (though that's really just an arbitrary option to be honest).

If you're not using Crowd this is actually much easier, because you can set a default mapping for each user that spans repositories. If you ARE using Crowd, though, your only option is the N*M entries in the User Mapping interface.
fields.summary: User Mapping across multiple repositories needs to be easier

fields.description:
we are loading all file revisions into memory which obviously will break on large changesets.

temp fix: limit to first 1000 file revisions

We need a initial page (http://cvs.zrh.swissre.com:8077/) with only the repository list without any further informations (history/activities/commits etc.) like in the version 1.5.4. (coming up in 2 seconds)

Please see also under https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-3277

Kind regards

Swiss Reinsurance Company Ltd
Andrin Sigel

In Fisheye site-url as the siteminder protected URL

fields.description:
We are in the process of converting our CVS repositories to Subversion.
When adding one of the converted repositories to FishEye, we run into problems.

On the machine, which runs FishEye, we get a popup with:
{noformat}
	Microsoft Visual C++ Runtime Library
	Runtime Error!
	Program: C:\WINDOWS\system32\java.exe
	This application has requested the Runtime to terminate it in an unusual way.
{noformat}

The log of FishEye contains:
{noformat}
	WARN  - Cancelling SVN Operation (diff -r 32368:32369 file:///C:/SvnData/Repositories/LegaSuite/trunk/LegaSuite@32369) on repository LegaSuite due to timeout
	WARN  - Interrupting SVN operation thread due to non-response: FishEye SVN Diff Fetcher:110
	WARN  - Interrupting SVN operation thread due to non-response: FishEye SVN Diff Fetcher:110
	[...]
	INFO   | jvm 1    | 2010/02/23 12:11:56 | Out of memory - terminating application.
	ERROR  | wrapper  | 2010/02/23 12:11:57 | JVM exited unexpectedly.
{noformat}

When looking at the revisions where the problems occur, we see that the 'diff' between revision 32368 and 32369 is quite large: 122 MB.
The 'diff' of the revisions before and after are only a few KB.

We think that the initial scan of FishEye cannot handle the amount of changes between revision 32368 and 32369.

We run FishEye as a service with the Tanuki Software Java wrapper. The amount of heap, we provide to the JVM, is 1.5 GB. That's the maximum we can provide, otherwise the JVM will not start anymore.
Because of an earlier issue, where the Java SVNKit had problems with our version of Subversion, we are now using the 'javahl' interface, provided by Subversion.
fields.summary: Cannot perform initial scan of converted repository

fields.description:
When indexing an area the message "Finished re-indexing changesets" will remain on the maintenance status page for a very long time.   This statement makes you think it is almost done working, when in reality Fisheye is doing a lot more steps regarding the scan in the background.

Can we find a way to update this message with something more useful such as "Analyzing Line Count Data" etc.  The larger the indexing (due to repository size) the longer the message appears.
fields.summary: "Finished re-indexing changesets" remains for a long time.  better document what is actually happening

fields.description:
Some customers would like to have users who can administer only certain parts of FE. 

It would be good if we could have for example a "repository admin" or a "user admin" that could create/update repos and users respectively but not change other settings.

Even a split similar to the Sysadmin/Admin roles in JIRA would be start.
fields.summary: Finer grained administration permissions

fields.description:
now that we store blame for every revision, we dont need to build up the blame from the entire history - we can just go back 1 ancestor

look at AuthorLinecountCalculator calcBlame() line 80

this should get an indexing performance boost, particularly for indexing new branches
fields.summary: we should not descend all revisions to get loc

fields.description:
If you have a file with a space or a special character in the name or path (i.e. tilde), the link on the changeset page to that file is broken.

For example if you view: http://fisheye.example.com/changelog/myCVSRepository/Test?cs=MAIN:username:20100224163641 and in that changeset is an update to a file {{/Test/test/~tilde/sp ace.doc}}.  If you click on the link to either view the old or new version of that file, you get 
{noformat}The requested resource cannot be found.
Path "Test/test/%7Etilde/sp%20ace.doc" does not exist.{noformat}

Apparently the escaping is incorrect.  Screenshot attached which shows some images as part of a changeset and the error.
fields.summary: Special characters in path break revision links in changesets

fields.description: For a number of support cases upgrading SVNKit to 1.3.2 has solved the issue. Possible to include in the FishEye distribution?

Avoid spurious package scanner warnings in the debug log
git repo updater cannot be set

fields.description:
h3. Original report

Currently there is no good documentation for how to customize the look and feel of FishEye.  Merely looking for something that would provide some guidance on what CSS styles to override/update to change common things, such as the colors of the header, tabs, links.  

The closest thing we have is "Customising FishEye's Look & Feel" (http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=92504217) which specifies _*where*_ you can put modified files, but that's it.  Being a JSP source-owning enterprise customer doesn't provide much value if we don't know _*how*_ to go about adding customized content.

Not looking for something as nice as JIRA's interface for customizing colors (although it would be nice), just some guidance on where the things are that we can change.

h3. Articles available

https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/customizing-fisheye-s-look-and-feel-960155679.html
https://confluence.atlassian.com/fishkb/customizing-fisheye-and-crucible-look-and-feel-428802654.html
https://developer.atlassian.com/server/fisheye-crucible/page-decorators/

h3. Plugins available

https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.fecru.plugins.fecru-look-and-feel-plugin/server/overview
fields.summary: Documentation for customizing look and feel

fields.description:
In previous versions of FishEye (pre 2.0), there was a link that would provide you with the latest and greatest revision of a file, in RAW format.  (see attached screenshot).  It does not appear there is a place in the new UI where this link can be obtained easily in 2.2.  Where'd it go?

The urls contained {{~raw,r=trunk}} or {{~raw,r=MAIN}}.

We generally used these types of links in documentation, for example giving the DBAs a URL to a post-refresh script.  They would always just pull the contents of that URL, not working about what the latest revision is, and we could update the file without have to notify them of a new revision.  Very useful link.
fields.summary: Cannot find link for downloading latest and greatest RAW revision of a file

fields.description:
We've just upgraded from FishEye 1.5 to 2.1.4 - looking forward to the newly improved GUI - at least, that is what we thought.

I'm not sure what happened here, but it is extremely difficult to navigate or get an overview of the information now - the output format takes up a lot more room than in the previous version and it feels like we've lost control unfortunately.

It seems that Jira/Confluence (which has a lot more of functionality) is significantly better structured and much easier to use than FishEye is now in the new version.

I really think the UI needs to be rethought significantly from scratch - I could try to come with individual cases for improvement, but I don't think that is a fruitful way forward - if you'd like a sounding board, I'd be happy to do it.

Just some short comments, not complete:

- One wants to follow commits and statistics for just a few releases (two, max three for us), one one or perhaps two screens (similar to Jira dashboards)
- Using FishEye as the "heart beat" of development by looking at the commits 

I really love the functionality and we are very happy customers for several of your other products - it just seems that FishEye really took a step backward in usability here - we know you can do a lot better! We've had multiple users complaining about it (not that it is different, we all hoped for that - just that it is unfortunately not even as good as the previous version)
fields.summary: FishEye UI needs a major overhaul after upgrading from 1.5 -> 2.1.4

fields.description:
Example is in the Updater for a Perforce Repository:

Take a repository and update the Poll Period to "never" by check marking the "Disable Polling" option.
Save Change
Display on the Repository Details page will say "Poll Period: Never"

Click on "Edit Poll Period"
No check-mark in "Disable Polling"
Click on Save Changes - Error message about a Non-Zero value
fields.summary: Updater - Poll Period - Disable Poll always remains unchecked for 'never'

fields.description: The ability to add repositories to Fisheye automatically when they are created would be very useful to us. This could either be done by monitoring the repository root from Fisheye, or by triggering a Subversion hook which instructed Fisheye to create the repository.
fields.summary: Monitor SVN root and automatically add repositories

fields.description: The Base ClearCase support within FishEye retrieves change set information for all branches included in a VOB. This can lead to a lot of duplicated information, so providing a facility for users to specify branches to be included in the indexing operation would be desirable.
fields.summary: Allow user to suppress specific branches

fields.description:
Currently, if a repository is in a queue to be updated (i.e the repository scanner is blocked else where) plugins have no way of finding out whether the data the FishEye is reporting is currently up to date. For plugins that store or cache data provided by FE/CRU, this means that the data they retain can easily be incorrect.

The repository indexing status reports if a repository is currently being indexed. *We need a new feature that reports how current the data is*, so that plugins caching or storing data will not cache or store invalid data.

Here is a complex usage to enhance the planning of this feature:

# A ReviewContentUpdated event is emitted to a plugin.
# The plugin waits before reindexing any new data, for the repository indexing status to report that it isn' currently indexing.
# The plugin gets the data from FE/CRU and stores it.
# The indexer resumes indexing.
# plugin data is out of date - and the plugin can't tell without running tests on it self
fields.summary: Repository indexers need to report how up to date their data is.

fields.description:
{quote}
Problem Description:
In our organization we have many Subversion repositories. IDeally these should be configured with a parent path so that Fisheye automatically lists all repositories under that path with a common configuration. Can this be done with Fisheye?

Example:
We have
/opt/svn/repo1
/opt/svn/repo2
/opt/svn/repo3

We want just to configure /opt/svn/* in Fisheye and Fisheye will serve all three repos.
{quote}
fields.summary: Manage repositories globally

fields.description:
I was just thinking some about stack traces and versions and tags.  And I don't know if this has been written yet, but I though it was worth seeding the idea if not.

We have a fisheye install that knows about revisions.  And we have a production application that generates exception reports.  The application knows the SVN revision it was built from.  Various revisions are pushed to prod from time to time, but HEAD has moved far beyond that by the time exceptions are generated.  So the exception reports might have some very funky line numbers.  

It would be really handy if there was Spring module that could be seeded with the SVN build number and the location of the repo such that Exception.printStackTrace generated HTML that actually linked to the correct source in Fisheye.  See what I mean?
fields.summary: Create application library for intelligent stack traces

fields.description:
Binary file in CVS showing LOC in FishEye

Re-produce steps :

1. Check in a binary file (sample attached : jxpiinstall.exe) with CVS
2. Go to FishEye Source tab, select the file from repository
3. Revisions tab, line number displayed (loc.png)
extra info,
4. Source tab, junk characters shown (source.png)

Same file check in with SVN and P4, it works fine (no lines number displayed and binary file message shown in source)

Reference:
[FSH-3144|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-3144]
fields.summary: Binary files in CVS contribute to LOC in FishEye
Ability to search in source code level

fields.description:
Perforce has implemented the feature called "P4toDB" which essentially replicates Perforce metadata 
into an SQL database, enabling you to use your preferred relational database for reporting and analysis.

With this approach, you can reduce the load on the Perforce server for these activities.

http://www.perforce.com/perforce/doc.092/user/p4todbnotes.txt

Some of our customers are running really large Perforce instance, and it would help them greatly
from performance point of view if FishEye can scan the replicated DB instead of "real" one.

Best regards,
JP Support
fields.summary: Allow FishEye to search DB created by "P4toDB"
Using Timezone.getInstance("GMT+0") can throw a NPE

fields.description:
There are instructions for configuring Fisheye to [start up on Mac OS X at boot time|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHKB/How+to+run+Fisheye+or+Crucible+on+startup+on+Mac+OS+X].  It would be helpful to have sample startup scripts (or documentation) for other environments.  Here's an example of a startup script tutorial provided by Customware:

http://www.customware.net/repository/display/ATLASSIAN/How+to+set+up+Fisheye+to+start+at+system+boot

Ideally, this page would provide some guidance regarding tools like Tanuki and Javawrapper (as referenced in FE-20), but this should only be combined with that issue if both things are accomplished at the same time.
fields.summary: Provide more startup script examples for Fisheye

fields.description:
The WADL docs are a bit of fail:

!http://img.skitch.com/20100204-tusei5ba6htrs8ugd6ku23bmy3.jpg!

The query parameter is actually an EyeQL query in the above example. The old docs that got deleted were better in that sense. 

We should describe each of the parameters to make it 100% clear what is required.
fields.summary: Document the parameters for the REST API Better
Allow to edit watches from user settings

fields.description:
During my initial scan, I'm seeing a bunch of errors in the logs. There are multiple cases like the below, for different files. In each case, the quoted path passed to "cleartool desc" has a trailing space before the end quote, which results in the desc failing. When I ran the same command myself, I got the same error - but when I removed that trailing space, the cleartool desc worked just fine. As I said, this doesn't seem to be universal, just for some files. Here's the text from Fisheye's error log (filename and branch name scrubbed for confidentiality reasons):

fields.summary: Trailing spaces added to some file names in scan, causing cleartool desc to fail

fields.description:
Unable to remove the project content when repository being renamed or deleted

Steps to reproduce :

# Create a project name "VK" in FishEye.
# Create a repository named "vk_new". ([vk_new.png|^vk_new.png])
# Add "vk_new" repository in FishEye.
# Go to Project List > view/edit FishEye Content, add directory to VK. ([project_content.png|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/36415/project_content.png])
# Delete the vk_new repository from FishEye or rename the "vk_new" repository to other name. 
# Go to Project List > view/edit FishEye Content, remove the "vk_new".
# Error - Repository does not exist. ([error.png|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/36414/error.png])
fields.summary: Cannot delete project content when repository being renamed or deleted

fields.description:
!http://img.skitch.com/20100202-jf7mj7cuay2hfuumeyh8fiakh2.jpg!

Click on the "show watches" link in an email sends you here. Note that I am logged into FE/CRU already. This is annoying. Either respect the already logged in user, or create a login box suited to the settings dialog.
fields.summary: Requests to show watches always makes a user login
Plugin developers creating multithreaded plugins have to deal with Disposer

fields.description:
When browsing the activity stream for a GIT project, the link in the guid part of "username committed guid to project" does *not* use the server URI variable, and instead uses the actual URI being browsed.

i.e. I have fisheye running behind a proxy, and the link that is generated is
http://192.168.26.1:8060/svn/changelog/EasyBCD/?cs=1f42dcc584b249a9c1d04bda09fd90b530e02f08

instead of 
http://neosmart.net/svn/changelog/EasyBCD/?cs=1f42dcc584b249a9c1d04bda09fd90b530e02f08

The rest of FishEye correctly uses the server URI config variable to generate links.
fields.summary: FishEye does not use server URI to generate link to GIT revision

fields.description:
We have Fisheye/Crucible integrated with JIRA.  

I believe that I've mapped everywhere I need to and I am able to view Crucible projects/reviews within JIRA Issues and also create reviews/view source from JIRA Issues.  However, when I click on the Projects tab in Fisheye/Crucible and then click on the inner Issues tab for any project, I'm getting no activity found.
fields.summary: Crucible Project Issues Tab isn't displaying my JIRA Issues

fields.description: There is no way to a) configure the poll period for a git repository in the UI (though it exists in the XML) and b) no way to configure the default for all repositories.  This is frustrating as git encourages many repositories and managing each one is very tedious, more so if you only can via XML.
fields.summary: Configurable polling period for Git repositories

fields.description:
When starting FishEye with an unmodified fisheyectl.sh it will fail on Solaris with the following error:

bin/fisheyectl.sh: syntax error at line 49: `FISHEYE_OPTS=$' unexpected


the reason to this is Solaris' ``/bin/sh'', which is not a bash.

The fix is trivial -- if you're using Bash features such as $(command), you should also use #!/bin/bash in the script.
fields.summary: Fisheye's default shell fails on Solaris

fields.description:
Most code is just noise that follows basic patterns and should not be counted in LOC.  For example a curly bracket "}" which ends any logical grouping of code on a new line, should not be considered a line of code.

Can you add the ability to include ignore regex's in the LOC counts?

Thanks
fields.summary: Ignore Pattern for LOC

fields.description:
I've configured fisheye with > 5 repositorys. All repositorys are configured to use the same servername but different usernames. For example:

Repo1:
SVN URL: https://example.com/svn/Repo1
Username: repo1

Repo2:
SVN URL: https://example.com/svn/Repo2
Username: repo2

[...]

When fisheye connects to the svn server, it authenticates at the Repo2 with the username "repo1". This goes for all of the following repositories. The only workaround is to use svn file:// urls. But this costs us a lot of superfluous diskspace. 

h1. Workaround
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/SVN+Authentication+Issues
fields.summary: Incorrect SVN username for multiple svn https:// repositories

The following exception sporadically occurs when viewing the 'Source' tab for an XML document.

{code}

	at com.atlassian.fisheye.clearcase.ClearCaseRevisionCache$1.startChunk(ClearCaseRevisionCache.java:301)
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.clearcase.client.ClearCaseBlameParser.parseLines(ClearCaseBlameParser.java:64)

fields.summary: NullPointerException generated when viewing XML documents

fields.description: In quick search results, the results are not rendering properly. The {{}} is showing up in the actual results displayed to the user. Tested on both Firefox 3.5.7 IE 7.0.5730.13 And both show the same issue. Here are the screenshots: [FireFox3|^FF3.JPG], [IE7|^IE7.JPG]
fields.summary: Quick search incorrectly shows the HTML result

fields.description: See title. Note this is already possible through the java api.
fields.summary: Expose the status of the repository scanner in the REST API.

fields.description:
cvs updater ignores period==0 if it finds a remote tag and goes ahead and does a full scan anyway.

if period is set to 0, we should _never_ do an automatic full scan (ie. manual scans will still work)
fields.summary: cvs updater ignores period==0 if it finds a remote tag

fields.description:
I already called Jira in San Francisco but was told I have to submit an issue for Fisheye.


We migrated this week from Jira 3 to jira 4.  We use also Fisheye and had Jira linked to Fisheye.

After the migration we were missing the Fisheye tab in our issues.

I thought I had to install the jira-fisheye-plugin and downloaded the jira-fisheye-plugin-3.0.11.jar which I then added to the <jira-home>/plugins/installed-plugins folder.  I previously installed greenhopper into that folder and know that this must be the right plugin folder.

I also double checked the Fisheye configuration in the Administrator section and added Jira to Fisheye as trusted application (got an id).

I still cannot see the Fisheye tab.  I the logfiles I noticed that there is a jira-fisheye-plugin-3.0.15.jar and I noticed that Jira installs bundled plug-in under <jira-home>/plugins/.bundled-plugins

I guess I should remove the 3.0.11 plugin from my installed-plugins folder.

But now the question is:  Why does no fishey tab show up.  What am I missing?
fields.summary: Fisheye Tab does not show up in issue

fields.description: I have an initial scan that's been running for 8 days now - the lshistory process is still running, in fact. I've run the exact same lshistory that's getting called by Fisheye myself, and it completed in 6 hours or so. There are a ton of events in this VOB, but still - something seems wrong with this.
fields.summary: Initial scan lshistory of large VOB never finishes

fields.description:
It would be great to have plugin points for user pages (ie /user/blah) and on the dashboard to allow personalised reports and plugins. 

For example, if someone were to write a commit/review/duedates calendar plugin, a desirable place to put it would be on the dashboard.

!http://img.skitch.com/20100119-re81fd8bx47hjshput42k27wt.jpg!
!http://img.skitch.com/20100119-cxmws1gp68qrhtrq4443a5gmpx.jpg!
*
The needful*: create webitems + decorators.
fields.summary: Add plugin points to the user page and dashboard.

fields.description: When Browsing a file in FishEye and have Atlassian Plugin installed in Eclipse, the eclipse icon appears for opening file in eclipse, but tooltip says "open XYZ in IDEA". Maybe "Open XYZ in IDE"???
fields.summary: Atlassian IDE Connector Button on browse has tooltip "Open XYZ in IDEA" when its actually eclipse (and showing eclipse logo)

fields.description:
* log out of http://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible
* check in code for an open Jira
* Go to Source tab on the Jira and click "Create crucible review"
* Will get redirected to Crucible login page - log in
* Will br prompted to create a review but will have no changeset context  - have to manually search for it.
fields.summary: "Create crucible review" in JIRA/Source Tab does not preserve changeset info when user not logged in

fields.description: Further information to be provided, see http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257329458#257329458
fields.summary: NPE reported when new directories/files are indexed

fields.description:
FishEye is currently not re-examining activity information after the initial indexing operation, so changes subsequently included in the activity after indexing are not visible in FishEye.

From http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257329458#257329458
fields.summary: FishEye should re-examine Activity contents to determine if subsequent changes have been added

fields.description: Information about the comparison between the VOB to include and the VOBs found during the ClearCase indexing process is currently being logged at INFO level - this should be changed to be logged at DEBUG level.
fields.summary: Information about VOB comparisons is being logged at INFO rather than DEBUG

fields.description:
From [FSH-3077|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-3077].

Currently, there is a known issue for ClearCase repository [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/ClearCase#ClearCase-KnownIssues]. XML files cannot be viewed as 'Annotated' source.

It would great if XML files are supported.
fields.summary: Support XML files for ClearCase repository

fields.description: At the moment we can only define one JIRA URL in the Fisheye admin and we use that for both API calls and displayed URLs. It would be good to have an option to define both the JIRA API url and JIRA display URL.
fields.summary: An option to define the JIRA API url and JIRA display URL

fields.description:
When a repository is being scanned no warnings are shown on the reports tab decorator page, which is a repository specific page. 

Plugin developers shouldn't need to do this themselves. 

The decorator key is fisheye.report.tab
fields.summary: Reports tab decorator does not show repository indexing warnings.

fields.description: The Allow Process rules (Include/Exclude) are applied after the execution of the 'cleartool lshistory' command has finished.  The rules should be inspected during the processing of each line of 'lshistory' output so that files which are to be excluded are not included in the processing.
fields.summary: Base ClearCase logic should apply the include/exclude rules when processing lshistory output

fields.description:
When starting Fisheye/Crucible with start.bat/start.sh, you`ll see the following message about "multiple SLF4J bindings":
{quote}
SLF4J: Class path contains multiple SLF4J bindings.
SLF4J: Found binding in [jar:file:/C:/Crucible2.1.2/lib/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.8.jar!/org/slf4j/impl/StaticLoggerBinder.class]
SLF4J: Found binding in [jar:file:/C:/Crucible2.1.2/bin/../lib/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.8.jar!/org/slf4j/impl/StaticLoggerBinder.class]
SLF4J: See http://www.slf4j.org/codes.html#multiple_bindings for an explanation.
{quote}

This happens if you do not define [FISHEYE_INST|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Installing+FishEye#InstallingFishEye-FISHEYEINST%28Optional%29] environment variable.
fields.summary: Multiple SLF4J bindings message while starting Fisheye/Crucible
